DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study see woman present emergency contraception ( EC ) willing accept copper intrauterine device ( IUD ) . This study also compare use effective method contraception woman select copper IUD Plan B 6 month receive EC .
DOC.brief_title: Copper T380 IUD Versus Oral Levonorgestrel Emergency Contraception vs. Plan B Emergency Contraception
DOC.detailed_description: This study seek estimate acceptance Copper IUD use amongst people present EC . This accomplished offering woman present EC participating Planned Parenthood Association Utah ( PPAU ) clinic study period option copper IUD Plan B . Women agree study participation follow 6 month . The primary outcome study use reliable method contraception 6 month present EC . Secondary outcomes measure pregnancy , abortion , repeat Plan B use , presence gonorrhea Chlamydia infection time presentation EC , number day first bleed episode duration bleed episode , bleed pattern , frequency unprotected intercourse , use barrier method prevention sexually transmitted infection , patient satisfaction choose method symptom possibly related contraception use . Patients select IUD assess IUD expulsion , perforation , removal .
DOC.criteria: Women 1845 year old , need EC ( unprotected intercourse within 120 hour ) , willing give consent participation research , willing comply study requirement , accessible telephone . Patients select IUD need identify desire longterm contraception . Current pregnancy , Had pelvic inflammatory disease septic abortion within past 3 month gonorrheal chlamydial infection last 60 day , Current behavior suggest high risk pelvic inflammatory disease Allergy copper , Wilson 's disease ( patient select Paragard ) allergy levonorgestrel ( patient select Plan B ) Intracavitary symptomatic uterine fibroid , abnormality uterus distort uterine cavity , Mucopurulent cervicitis , A previously place IUD remove Genital bleed unknown etiology Ovarian , cervical endometrial cancer , Small uterine cavity
